column4: earlier today i had windows Xp on my computer which is an Hp Dv6000 and the wireless wasnt working i think it was uninstalled cause nothing was showing up about a broadcom driver so it was gone but one of my good buddies decided to install ubuntu on my comp without fixing the wireless problem 1st
what is bios
isn't there a on/off switch on the laptop to turn the wifi on?
could you please pastebin the output of the dmesg command?
sorry, didn't see it. could you point me to the url?
hrm. how about the whole dmesg command without the tail?
look, do you know how to install software with apt-get?
can you open a terminal?
okay, did you get the terminal open? let me know when you did..
now, type first:   sudo apt-get update
it will ask you for your password, type it in and let it rip
did it perform the update alright?
last line should say this: Reading package lists... Done
good. now type:  sudo apt-get install pastebin
sorry, that should've been:  sudo apt-get install pastebinit
good, now type:  dmesg | pastebinit
yes, then paste it here :)
okay, good. looks like linux doesn't even see your wifi... which is, of course, bad. :)
I'm with ActionParsnip on this, check your bios settings
when you turn the computer on, you should be able to press F2 and get to it
check your documentation if you still have it
did you find your hp documentation?
what you mean hp documentation
